original_title: Chief custodian of Ruhunu Kataragama Devalaya granted bail
original_body_lines: The chief custodian of the Ruhunu Kataragama Devalaya has been granted bail on orders of the Tissamaharama Magistrate’s Court.
Somipala. T. Ratnayake was produced before the court after he was arrested in connection with the disappearance of a ‘golden tray’ offered to the Kataragama Devalaya.
Accordingly, the suspect was released on two personal bails of Rs.500,000 each, and on the condition that he appear before the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) on the last Sunday of each month.
Somipala. T. Ratnayaka was arrested after he surrendered to the CCD earlier today (27 Dec.).

Earlier on 19 December, the custodian responsible for the storage room of the Devalaya had surrendered to the CCD in connection with the same incident. Following submissions to the Tissamaharama Court, the Attorney General directed the CCD to arrest both custodians.
When CCD officers visited the homes of the two custodians, family members stated that they had traveled to Colombo for medical treatment.
In 2019, the wife of the notorious fugitive gangster ‘Angoda Lokka,’ found dead in Coimbatore, India in 2020, had offered the 38-pound golden tray to the Kataragama Devalaya.
Subsequent investigations revealed that the golden tray had been placed inside the room of the chief custodian, Somipala Ratnayake.
Upon learning of the disappearance of the item, a formal complaint was lodged in 2021 by the Basnayake Nilame of Kataragama Devalaya.
The investigations were later handed over to the CCD on the directives of Acting IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon. The CCD officers sought advice from the Attorney General in this regard.
